Patient Name: Breau ,  John           Procedure Date: 2/12/2024 12:23 PM
MRN: 8240512                          CSN: 1104308734
Case ID: 3098789                      Date of Birth: 12/20/1971
Gender: Male                          Attending Physician: Reza Hejazi , MD,
 1598050700
_______________________________________________________________________________
 
Procedure:                    Upper GI endoscopy
Indications:                  Heartburn, Esophageal reflux symptoms that 
                              persist despite appropriate therapy, Esophageal 
                              reflux symptoms that recur despite appropriate 
                              therapy
Providers:                    Reza Hejazi, MD (Doctor), Kathy Grigsby 
                              (Nurse), Erin Skinner (Technician)
Referring Physician:          John J. May, MD (Referring MD)
Medications:                  Monitored Anesthesia Care
Complications:                No immediate complications.
_______________________________________________________________________________
Procedure:
     Pre-Anesthesia Assessment:
     - Prior to the procedure, a History and Physical was performed, and 
     patient medications and allergies were reviewed. The patient's tolerance 
     of previous anesthesia was also reviewed. The risks and benefits of the 
     procedure and the sedation options and risks were discussed with the 
     patient. All questions were answered, and informed consent was obtained. 
     Prior Anticoagulants: The patient has taken no anticoagulant or 
     antiplatelet agents. ASA Grade Assessment: II - A patient with mild 
     systemic disease. After reviewing the risks and benefits, the patient 
     was deemed in satisfactory condition to undergo the procedure.
     - Prior Aspirin/ NSAID therapy: The patient has taken no aspirin or 
     NSAID medications.
     After obtaining informed consent, the endoscope was passed under direct 
     vision. Throughout the procedure, the patient's blood pressure, pulse, 
     and oxygen saturations were monitored continuously. The Endoscope was 
     introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the second part of 
     duodenum. The upper GI endoscopy was accomplished without difficulty. 
     The patient tolerated the procedure well.
Findings:
     Esophagogastric landmarks were identified: the Z-line was found at 40 cm 
     from the incisors.
     A 2 cm hiatal hernia was found. The proximal extent of the gastric folds 
     (end of tubular esophagus) was 40 cm from the incisors. The hiatal 
     narrowing was 42 cm from the incisors.
     The esophagus and gastroesophageal junction were examined with white 
     light and narrow band imaging (NBI) from a forward view and retroflexed 
     position. There were esophageal mucosal changes suspicious for 
     short-segment Barrett's esophagus, classified as Barrett's stage C0-M1 
     per Prague criteria. These changes involved the mucosa extending to the 
     Z-line (40 cm from the incisors). Two tongues of salmon-colored mucosa 
     were present from 39 to 40 cm. The maximum longitudinal extent of these 
     esophageal mucosal changes was 1 cm in length. Mucosa was biopsied with 
     a cold forceps for histology in a targeted manner and in 4 quadrants at 
     intervals of 0.5 cm in the lower third of the esophagus. One specimen 
     bottle was sent to pathology. Verification of patient identification for 
     the specimen was done. Estimated blood loss was minimal.
     No other significant abnormalities were identified in a careful 
     examination of the esophagus.
     Multiple 4 to 10 mm pedunculated and sessile polyps with no bleeding and 
     no stigmata of recent bleeding were found in the gastric fundus and in 
     the gastric body. The polyp was removed with a cold snare. Resection and 
     retrieval were complete. Verification of patient identification for the 
     specimen was done. Estimated blood loss was minimal.
     Normal mucosa was found in the entire examined stomach. Biopsies were 
     taken with a cold forceps for Helicobacter pylori testing. Verification 
     of patient identification for the specimen was done. Estimated blood 
     loss was minimal.
     The gastroesophageal flap valve was visualized endoscopically and 
     classified as Hill Grade III (minimal fold, loose to endoscope, hiatal 
     hernia likely).
     No gross lesions were noted in the entire examined duodenum.
                                                                               
Impression:                   - Esophagogastric landmarks identified.
                              - 2 cm hiatal hernia.
                              - Esophageal mucosal changes suspicious for 
                              short-segment Barrett's esophagus, classified 
                              as Barrett's stage C0-M1 per Prague criteria. 
                              Biopsied.
                              - Multiple gastric polyps. Resected and 
                              retrieved.
                              - Normal mucosa was found in the entire 
                              stomach. Biopsied.
                              - Gastroesophageal flap valve classified as 
                              Hill Grade III (minimal fold, loose to 
                              endoscope, hiatal hernia likely).
                              - No gross lesions in the entire examined 
                              duodenum.
Estimated Blood Loss:         Estimated blood loss: none.
Recommendation:               - Patient has a contact number available for 
                              emergencies. The signs and symptoms of 
                              potential delayed complications were discussed 
                              with the patient. Return to normal activities 
                              tomorrow. Written discharge instructions were 
                              provided to the patient.
                              - Resume previous diet.
                              - Continue present medications.
                              - Await pathology results.
                              - Return to GI clinic at appointment to be 
                              scheduled.
                                                                               
Scope In: 12:51:25 PM
Scope Out: 1:07:28 PM
Total Procedure Duration Time 0 hours 16 minutes 3 seconds 
Procedure Code(s):            --- Professional ---
                              43251, Esophagogastroduodenoscopy, flexible, 
                              transoral; with removal of tumor(s), polyp(s), 
                              or other lesion(s) by snare technique
                              43239, 59,51, Esophagogastroduodenoscopy, 
                              flexible, transoral; with biopsy, single or 
                              multiple
Diagnosis Code(s):            --- Professional ---
                              K22.70, Barrett's esophagus without dysplasia
                              K44.9, Diaphragmatic hernia without obstruction 
                              or gangrene
                              K31.7, Polyp of stomach and duodenum
                              R12, Heartburn
                              K21.9, Gastro-esophageal reflux disease without 
                              esophagitis
